citation.article-title: Marinobacter daqiaonensis sp. nov., a moderate halophile isolated from a Yellow Sea salt pond
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Marinobacter daqiaonensis sp. nov.
Marinobacter daqiaonensis (da.qia.o.nen′sis. N.L. masc. adj. daqiaonensis of or belonging to the Daqiao Saltern, where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-negative, oxidase- and catalase-positive rods (0.4–0.7 µm wide and 2.5–4.0 µm long) and motile with a single polar flagellum.
Colonies on MA are small, cream, flat and circular (1.0–2.0 mm in diameter) after 2–3 days at 30 °C.
Grows with 1–15 % (w/v) NaCl (optimum 5–10 % NaCl), at 10–45 °C (optimum 30 °C) and at pH 5–9 (optimum pH 7.5).
Positive for H2S production, but negative for nitrate reduction, nitrite reduction, indole production, oxidation and fermentation of glucose and Voges–Proskauer and methyl red tests.
Hydrolyses Tween 20, aesculin, starch and urease, but not Tween 80, gelatin or DNA.
With API 50 CH, positive only for 5-ketogluconate.

With API ZYM, positive for esterase lipase (C8) and leucine aminopeptidase, weakly positive for alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), valine aminopeptidase, cystine aminopeptidase, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphoamidase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, but negative for lipase (C14), trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, α- and β-galactosidases, β-glucuronidase, α- and β-glucosidases, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase.

Susceptible to (µg per disc unless otherwise stated) nalidixic acid (30), novobiocin (30), polymyxin B (300 U), chloramphenicol (30) and rifampicin (5), but resistant to doxycycline (30), streptomycin (10), tetracycline (30), penicillin G (10 U), carbenicillin (100), vancomycin (30), neomycin (30), kanamycin (30), ampicillin (10), lincomycin (2), clindamycin (2), oxacillin (1) and erythromycin (15).

As sole carbon and energy sources, utilizes d-mannose, cellobiose, adonitol, starch, ethanol, d-mannitol, d-salicin, trehalose, d-fructose, lactose, d-galactose, gluconate, d-glucose, maltose, propionate and ribose, but not sorbitol, aesculin, formate, myo-inositol, malonate, l-arabinose, citrate, fumarate or glycerol.
The main cellular fatty acids (>10 %) are C18 : 1ω9c, C16 : 0 and C19 : 0 cyclo ω10c/C19 : 1ω6c.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 60.8 mol%.
The type strain is YCSA40T ( = CGMCC 1.9167T = NCCB 100308T = LMG 25365T), isolated from sediment of Daqiao saltern, Jimo, Qingdao, on the east coast of China.
